title: Analyzing Spontaneity Conditions
text: To find under what conditions a reaction is spontaneous, you need to use Gibbs free energy equation: $$ΔG=ΔH-T$$ × ΔS. The reaction is spontaneous when $$\Delta G<0$$.

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: Given that $$ΔH=-92.4$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and $$ΔS=-198.3$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ K, convert ΔS to $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ K by dividing by $$1000$$.

title: Equation Setup to Determine Temperature
text: Set up the equation for spontaneity $$ΔG=ΔH-T$$ × ΔS and solve for T when $$\Delta G<0$$.

title: Solving the Equation for T
text: Rearrange the inequality, so it becomes $$T>\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta S}$$.

title: Calculating Required Temperature
text: Now that you have the expression $$T>\frac{92.4}{0.1983}$$, calculate the value of T.

title: Interpreting the Results
text: The calculated temperature represents the maximum temperature at which the reaction will be spontaneous.
